awd_titl_txt: I-Corps: Systemization and Digitization of Career Exploration Coaching
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this I-Corps project is to alleviate and improve the high rate of disengagement of the US workforce (i.e. alleviating the current struggle professionals face to have the right resource and guidance they need in order to find job fit). Additional societal issues that may be  resolved include the "purpose gap" at work and high turnover/job attrition rates. The impacts of disengagement at work include impacts to individuals' wellbeing, organizations' bottom line and level of employee productivity, and subsequent costs to the economy. The impact of this project will improve the value and ability of higher education to meet societal expectations and improve students' prospects. 
This project will enable individuals to find job fit early on, avoid job hopping and be engaged and productive at work so they and their companies, economies, and societies thrive. By advancing individuals' career process, the project can enable them to play a more impactful role in society.

This I-Corps project is exploring career coaching automation by pairing technology where it works best with human interaction where it is needed. The project leverages advanced technology to automate and scale career guidance to every professional, including cloud-based tools, chatbots, sentiment analysis and audio capabilities. The project explores how technology can learn about individuals and help them learn about themselves and their career options. This career assessment tool is based on a new methodology and format, where free-form text (user generated content) produces stronger outputs than competitors. The platform enables continuous learning and reflection by systematizing coaching through a structured, iterative, ongoing process, leading to clarity and confidence in one's path.  The platform also guides users by releasing guidance and resources as the user is ready for it coupled with on-demand and real time support. Through data science, data visualization, and machine learning, the project will empower professionals to be thoughtful at every career step.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
WOKEN includes career coaching services that are complemented by a custom web-based platform to guide individuals through a unique, step-by-step process of learning and reflection to clarify their ideal career path. We also support individuals with upskilling decisions, personal branding, job searching, onboarding and career management. WOKEN’s mission is to reduce the 68% of the US workforce that is disengaged or actively disengaged at work (Gallup) -- “80% of college graduates said that it is very important to derive a sense of purpose from their work, yet less than half have succeeded in finding it. This ‘purpose gap’ is a glaring problem for the younger workforce and is a challenge for employers due to a strong correlation between employees’ purpose and engagement and an organization’s bottom line” (Gallup/Bates). Millennial turnover costs the U.S. economy $30.5B/year (Gallup, 2016). Actively disengaged employees cost the U.S. $450B-$550B in lost productivity per year (Gallup, 2013). Gallup/Bates say that “Higher education has a central role in improving [individuals’] life prospects and strengthening economy and society,” yet “universities are not meeting a common expectation.” WOKEN enables job fit early on so individuals avoid job hopping and are engaged and productive at work so they and their companies, economies, and societies thrive.

WOKEN’s process uses a design-thinking based approach to career exploration, which effectively helps professionals uncover which role and industry is the most suitable path for them. By leveraging a user-driven, open-ended process, the individual owns their learning, reflection, and iteration, to continue narrowing in on their career choices until they feel confident in which role, industry and environment is most fitting and suitable for them based on a realistic understanding of the work and their understanding of themselves. The transparent, digital workspace enables coaches to better support clients by facilitating and directly reviewing their progress. The platform’s accountability mechanisms ensure the client is staying on track towards their goals. By leveraging design, we facilitate an individual’s ability to know what to do, when to do it, why to do it, how to do it, and where to do it, to ensure they can remain in the driver’s seat and make progress on learning and reflection, rather than guessing what steps to pursue, how, and when. The clients’ personal branding, upskilling decisions, and job search all become more effective and efficient due to their stronger sense of an authentic career direction.

This grant allowed us to focus on customer discovery for the business-to-business segment (B2B), exploring possibilities with universities, outplacement centers, and coaching groups. Since our 2019 NSF grant, WOKEN has generated over $50K in revenue, supported over 125 paying clients, seen an average retention of ~4 months per client, earned an average revenue of $241/client, and currently services around 40 clients/month (as of October 2021). We have also designed, developed, and launched two versions of our software (most recent was launched in January 2021). We have partnered with several companies to run virtual career events (General Assembly, Forte Foundation, Commonpoint Queens/Ladders for Leaders/Jewish Foundation for Education of Women, NYC Tech Talent Pipeline, and more). We also ran several workshops as well as a 4 month coaching cohort with She Leads Edu to support 10 female leaders in education to pursue the career exploration process and clarify their next career steps. We have seen numerous clients make career pivots and land new jobs. We have proved that our process, tools, and offerings have shown to impact our three core metrics: 1) improving career clarity 2) improving one’s certainty on your career approach and 3) reducing career stress. We have helped a range of professionals across a variety of ages (20-70), roles, industries, international domains, and more. Notable career pivots include: Speech language pathologist → UX Designer; Financial services professional → Marriage/Family therapist; Teacher → Project Manager/SCRUM master; Client Relations → UX Designer, Operations → Chief of Staff, Accounting Coordinator → Virologist, Restaurant Server → PhD candidate, and more. We have helped professionals land jobs at companies like Zoom, Pearson, Kluk Farber Law, Your Talent Agency, Standard Motor Products, and more. 

WOKEN’s CEO & Founder is Rachel Serwetz, an ICF-Certified Coach. Her background includes a Tech MBA from NYU Stern and a Bachelors of Science in Human Development from Binghamton University. She has worked at Goldman Sachs and Bridgewater Associates prior to becoming a coach, and she has served as a career coach at Columbia University, Flatiron School/WeWork, Project Activate, and more. She is also an Adjunct Professor of Entrepreneurship at Binghamton University.


 


Last Modified: 10/27/2021
Modified by: Jamie Eggers
